instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPVOUT_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_LCDBKLT is the backlight power rail that is responsible for creating a backlight o nthe screen. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 no power
threads.message:
Hi, 
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 that had liquid contact, and has no power.
Om ampmetter it puls 5.16V and 0A.
I supose that I should start to check CC1/2 on <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>, but I realy don't know where to start.  Am I right? If any is damaged, can I replace it with one of other model board? JT700 is burnt. Can I replace it with one of other board model (don't have any board of this model)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 no power
threads.message:
If you get 5V from charger, CC1/2 lines should be good.

The board is probably trash, after liquid damage.
You can check diode mode to ground on the coils, at least.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 no power
threads.message:
Hi,
No big coil seams to be shorted. Diode reading seams normal.
However LT700 is burnt, and <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is shorted

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I managed to power it on. It had the <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_USBC_AON</SIGNAL> area oxidated and after replacing some caps and cleaning it, now powers on again and boots to OS. However T2174 is missing. Should I jumper it?

Can I take the burnt  JT700 and  LT700  from other board model?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 no power
threads.message:
Be sure the trace of T2174 is not broken; in case the TP is in the middle.

You can take L/JT700 from different board, no problem.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 no power
